intro: Alsine glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular alsike, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae, which includes many flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in prairies and along stream banks. Alsine glandulosa is also known for its ability to tolerate a variety of environmental conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
